Source code for heliolib.feature_engineering_service.test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant

import pandas as pd
import pytest

from heliolib.feature_engineering_service import ExpectedParametersGenerator
from .test_creating_the_mock_data import (
    fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe,
    fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe,
)




[docs]
def create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_valid_system_age():
    """
    Create an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

    This function fetches valid array info and plant table dataframes using the
    TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe()
    function. It also fetches valid inverter and meteo dataframes using the
    TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe()
    function. Then it creates an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class
    with the fetched data and returns the created object.

    Returns:
    -------
    expected_object : ExpectedParametersGenerator
        An instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

    """
    (
        array_info,
        plant_table,
    ) = fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe()
    (
        _,
        meteo_data,
    ) = fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe()
    expected_object = ExpectedParametersGenerator(
        meteo_data=meteo_data,
        array_info=array_info,
        system_age=plant_table["system_age"].values[0],
    )
    return expected_object






[docs]
def create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_invalid_system_age():
    """
    Create an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

    This function fetches valid array info and plant table dataframes using the
    TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe()
    function. It also fetches valid inverter and meteo dataframes using the
    TestCreatingTheMockData.fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe()
    function. Then it creates an instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class
    with the fetched data, but sets the system age as a string instead of an integer.
    Finally, it returns the created object.

    Returns:
    -------
    expected_object : ExpectedParametersGenerator
        An instance of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class.

    """
    (
        array_info,
        plant_table,
    ) = fetching_array_info_and_plant_table_valid_dataframe()
    (
        _,
        meteo_data,
    ) = fetching_inverter_and_meteo_valid_dataframe()
    expected_object = ExpectedParametersGenerator(
        meteo_data=meteo_data,
        array_info=array_info,
        system_age=str(plant_table["system_age"].values[0]),
    )
    return expected_object






[docs]
def test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant_valid():
    """
    Test the expected degradation of the plant when the system age is valid.

    This test function creates an object of the ExpectedParametersGenerator class
    using the create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_valid_system_age()
    function. It then calls the __expected_degradation() method on the object and
    checks if the output is an instance of pd.Series.

    Returns:
        None
    """
    expected_object = (
        create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_valid_system_age()
    )
    expected_degradation = (
        expected_object._ExpectedParametersGenerator__expected_degradation()
    )

    assert isinstance(expected_degradation, pd.Series)






[docs]
def test_expected_degradation_of_the_plant_invalid():
    """
    Test the expected degradation of the plant when the system age is invalid.

    This test function generates an object with expected parameters using the
    create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_invalid_system_age()
    function. Then it tests whether calling the __expected_degradation() method
    on the object raises a TypeError with the expected error message.

    Returns:
        None
    """
    expected_object = (
        create_object_of_expected_parameters_generator_with_invalid_system_age()
    )
    with pytest.raises(TypeError) as error:
        _ = expected_object._ExpectedParametersGenerator__expected_degradation()

    assert str(error.value) == "'>' not supported between instances of 'str' and 'int'"
